framework.name: Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive
framework.description: EU directive requiring comprehensive sustainability reporting based on European Sustainability Reporting Standards (ESRS)
framework.applicability: Large companies and listed small and medium enterprises in the EU

phase1.applicability: Large companies already subject to NFRD (>500 employees)

phase2.applicability: Large companies not currently subject to NFRD (>250 employees or €50M turnover or €25M assets)

phase3.applicability: Listed small and medium enterprises (except micro enterprises)

phase4.applicability: Non-EU companies with significant EU operations (>€150M EU turnover)

cross_cutting.name: General Requirements
cross_cutting.description: General requirements for sustainability reporting under CSRD

cross_cutting.name: General Disclosures
cross_cutting.description: General information about the undertaking and its sustainability reporting process

environmental.name: Climate Change
environmental.description: Climate change mitigation, climate change adaptation and energy
environmental.materiality_assessment: Required, but disclosure mandatory regardless of materiality assessment outcome

environmental.name: Pollution
environmental.description: Pollution of air, water and soil

governance.name: Business Conduct
governance.description: Business conduct matters including corporate culture, protection of whistle-blowers, animal welfare, and political engagement
Governance processes, controls and procedures to monitor, manage and oversee impacts, risks and opportunities
datapoints: Role of administrative, management and supervisory bodies
Information provided to and sustainability matters addressed by bodies

strategy.description: Strategy and business model in relation to sustainability matters
datapoints: Material impacts, risks and opportunities and how they interact with strategy and business model

impact_risk_opportunity_management.description: Process to identify and assess material sustainability-related impacts, risks and opportunities
datapoints: Process to identify and assess material impacts, risks and opportunities

metrics_targets.description: Targets in relation to material sustainability matters and progress towards achieving those targets
datapoints: Targets related to material sustainability matters

double_materiality.description: Assessment must consider both impact materiality and financial materiality

impact_materiality.definition: Sustainability matter is material from impact perspective if it relates to actual or potential impacts on people or the environment
impact_materiality.threshold: Matters are material if they meet criteria for significance of impact

financial_materiality.definition: Sustainability matter is material from financial perspective if it triggers or could trigger material financial effects
financial_materiality.threshold: Matters are material if they influence or could influence development, financial performance, financial position, cash flows, access to finance or cost of capital

assessment_process: Identify actual and potential impacts, risks and opportunities
Assess materiality of risks and opportunities
Determine material sustainability matters for reporting

value_chain.upstream: Activities, business relationships and impacts that occur in the course of, or as a result of, the production of goods or provision of services by the undertaking
value_chain.downstream: Activities and business relationships that occur after the goods or services have left the undertaking
reporting_requirements: Material impacts, risks and opportunities in value chain
Due diligence processes applied to value chain
Actions taken and planned to address material sustainability matters in value chain

assurance.requirement: Limited assurance initially, reasonable assurance from 2028
assurance.auditor: Statutory auditor or independent assurance services provider
assurance.standards: EU audit standards and international audit standards

digitalization.requirement: All sustainability information must be marked up in European Single Electronic Format (ESEF)
digitalization.accessibility: Enhanced accessibility and analysis of sustainability data

scoring.materiality_bonus: Additional points for comprehensive materiality assessment

sector_agnostic.applicability: ESRS standards apply to all sectors
sector_agnostic.sector_specific: Additional sector-specific standards may be developed
sector_agnostic.proportionality: Some relief for listed SMEs through simplified standards

integration.management_report: Sustainability information must be included in management report

other_frameworks.eu_taxonomy: Taxonomy disclosures integrated within ESRS framework
other_frameworks.gri: ESRS developed with consideration of GRI standards

penalties.member_state_enforcement: Member states must establish effective, proportionate and dissuasive penalties
penalties.public_naming: Public disclosure of penalties and sanctions

timeline.2024: ESRS standards adoption and first application year
timeline.2028: Reasonable assurance requirement and non-EU companies
timeline.2029: Full implementation across all applicable entities

regulatoryMandates.applicability: Large companies and listed SMEs in EU

reporting.digitalFormat: ESEF format with digital taxonomy tagging
reporting.languages: Available in all EU official languages
